title: Prashant Gupta
text: This is one of the best platforms for investment, but applying for an IPO is frustrating. Recently, the application process gets stuck on "sending application to exchange," failing to generate a number or send a mandate. Other platforms like AngelOne and INDmoney are much faster. But I prefer using Groww, so I often have to cancel and reapply to get my application submitted, which is especially stressful on the final day.

title: SANT KUMAR
text: I've been using the Groww app for a while now, and it's fantastic for tracking investments, mutual funds, and buying/selling stocks. The UI is clean, and it's beginner-friendly. However, one feature that could take it to the next level would be stock recommendations for both long-term investments and short-term trades (like swing trading). It would be super helpful to get insights, expert analysis, or even curated stock lists based on different time horizons and risk appetites.

title: Karan Govindani
text: I regret choosing this platform. While the user interface looks polished and onboarding was smooth, the app fails spectacularly at the absolute most critical time for any trader: market opening. Every single morning, without fail, as the clock hits 9:15 AM (or within the first five crucial minutes), the servers completely seize up. The app becomes unresponsive, trades won't execute, and worst of all, I can't exit positions. This isn't a minor glitch; it is a fundamental flaw

title: Malhar Meher
text: I'm very disappointed with this app. Used to like this app because of it's super fast order placements and simple UI. but on 14th October, I was placing my order to sell shares of LG at 50% but due to some error I wasn't able to sell. I tried 4 times but it failed. After 15minutes, I did sell the shares but at less profit at 44%. Hence I was able to book less profit. If such problem continues I may suffer a huge loss in the future. that's why I don't want to use this app anymore.

title: Abhishek Kumar
text: The app is becoming worse day by day. title: Sukesh Shetty
text: Super impressed! The documentation process was incredibly quick and effortless. All my mutual funds were auto-loaded from the central repository, requiring zero manual effort. If the payout is completed within the estimated timeline, this would be an outstanding overall experience.

title: 43 Noah Jehiel Vaz
text: Groww is one of the smoothest and easiest apps for beginners in trading and investing. The interface is clean, buying and selling stocks is simple, and GTT orders make it beginner-friendly. However, the app still needs a few advanced features like stop-loss / take-profit for delivery trades and trailing stop-loss options for swing traders. Adding those would make Groww perfect for both new and active users. Overall, it‚Äôs great for starting out, learning, and building a long-term portfolio
